summary: This is a transcript of a July 2, 2019, grand jury proceeding in the Southern District of New York regarding the investigation of Jeffrey Epstein. An FBI Special Agent from the Violent Crimes Against Children Squad testifies about evidence, including phone records, a deposit slip, and messages retrieved from a trash pull at Epstein's Palm Beach residence, linking associates and activities across state lines.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the grand jury investigation for alleged crimes involving child exploitation and human trafficking.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: The testifying witness from the FBI's Violent Crimes Against Children Squad, providing evidence and hearsay regarding the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: MS.
persons.context: The prosecutor examining the FBI Special Agent before the grand jury.

persons.name: The Foreperson
persons.context: The foreperson of the grand jury who swears in the witness and grants permission to excuse them.

connections.description: The Special Agent is testifying about her participation in the FBI investigation of Epstein and his associates.
MM is identified as Epstein's assistant who made phone calls to schedule massages and connect calls to Epstein.

events.title: Previous Grand Jury Testimony
events.description: The FBI Special Agent previously testified before the same grand jury, and a transcript (Exhibit 3) and PowerPoint presentation (Exhibit 1) from that date are referenced.

events.title: Phone Call Between Associates
events.description: Phone records show a call between a phone number subscribed to an individual in Maspeth and another associate's cell phone.

events.title: Deposit Slip Date
events.description: A deposit slip dated January 4, 2005, is discussed, corroborating the timeline of activities near the January 3rd phone call.

events.title: Trash Pull at Epstein Residence
events.description: The Palm Beach Police Department retrieved documents, including a list of phone messages for Jeffrey Epstein, from a trash pull at his Palm Beach residence.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, New York 10007
Fink & Carney Reporting and Video Services, 39 West 37th Street, New York, New York 10018
keyFacts: The FBI obtained a list of phone messages for Jeffrey Epstein from a trash pull conducted by the Palm Beach Police Department at Epstein's residence on April 13, 2005.
Messages in the trash pull document indicate communication across state lines, as messages left in New York were found in Florida.
A witness (name redacted) recalled receiving calls from Epstein's assistant, MM, who would sometimes call from New York, and would then connect calls to Epstein himself.
The same witness described being asked by both MM and Epstein to bring specific girls for appointments.
The testifying FBI Special Agent works on the Violent Crimes Against Children Squad, investigating child exploitation and human trafficking matters related to Epstein.
